results.title: Fearless: the Hunterwali story
results.creator_credit: Riyad Vinci Wadia and Wadia Movietone
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the life of Australian born actress Mary Evans who performed in numerous Indian films of the 1930s and 1940s under the alluring nom-de-plume Fearless Nadia. With her buxom physique, blonde hair and blue eyes Nadia’s roles typically showed her displaying incredible strength and fortitude in the face of marauding forces and wicked villains. Her roles included “Hunterwali” (1935), “Diamond Queen” (1940), “Jungle Princess” (1942), “Tigress” (1948) and “Jungle Queen” (1956), among others. Nadia challenged the traditionally submissive roles played by women in Indian cinema and performed many amazing and dangerous stunts required for the action and swashbuckling genres in which she extensively worked. J.B.H. Wadia (1901-86), a frequent collaborator of Nadia’s, became a master of adventure films as a successful director and producer along with his brother Homi. Features extensive interviews with Fearless Nadia reminiscing upon her life in the cinema; intrepid stuntman and actor John Cavas (aka Cawas) who worked extensively with Nadia; as well as several other Indian filmmaker contemporaries of Nadia. Numerous clips from Nadia’s oeuvre are shown alongside explanations of dangerous stunt work and co-ordination, and technical developments in cinema. With English subtitles.

constellations_other.name: Fearless women
constellations_other.description: Australian born Fearless Nadia would skyrocket to Bollywood fame in her first leading role as Princess Madhuri / the caped crusader herself Hunterwali. Translated in English as a Woman with a whip, Nadia delighted audiences with her daring stunts and circus skills.

results.title: Silent Number
results.creator_credit: Jamie Blanks, Hugh Burton and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Babysitter Nicole is subjected to a horrific night of phone calls from a guy called Matt, claiming to be beaten by his father and imprisoned in a cold place. When a bloodied man comes to the door claiming that he and his wife have been in an accident, she decides it is time to call the police. Cast includes Bronwyn Jones and John Brumpton.

results.title: The Fair go: winning the 1967 referendum
results.creator_credit: Pat Laughren, Canute Films and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description: This documentary commemorates the 10 year campaign that won an unprecedented 90.77% Yes vote in the 1967 Referendum about Indigenous citizenship. Until that referendum the people of the oldest civilisation in the world were not counted as citizens in their own land. Told through personal interviews and rare archival footage, this film details the efforts of the people who helped change the Constitution. Narrated by Deborah Mailman.

results.title: My survival as a deviant
results.brief_description: Director Toby Zoates takes his camera to the squats of inner Sydney in an attempt to ascertain who the real deviants of society are - those who choose to do things their own way, or those that try to stop them. Utilising the cinema verite style and a punk soundtrack, he interviews a cross-section of people affected by issues such as unemployment and drugs, and examines the tactics those disenfranchised by societal pressures use to survive. This documentary, shot during Malcolm Fraser’s reign as Prime Minister, looks at the mundane reality of life for many young people, and aims to persuade viewers to take political action against a system that is seen to oppress individuality and demonise non-conformist behaviour. Filmed around Pyrmont, Kings Cross, and Chippendale.

results.title: Coal
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Advance Australia”.
Elementary account of Australia’s coal industry showing models of coal formations; the principal coal mining areas of Australia; views of Wollongong, Newcastle and Lithgow, centres of coal mining areas; open cut mining at Musellbrook; the uses to which coal is put and some of its principal by-products.

results.title: The Magic Trumpet
results.creator_credit: Dusan Marek, Anim-ad Films and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: An experimental film using mainly animated paper cut-outs to tell the story of a magic trumpet which brings fame and fortune to an old tramp. Story script by Tim Burstall, music by Michael Kenny and montage, animation and photography by Dusan Marek.

results.title: Circling the globe in comfort
results.creator_credit: Jaaf Nieuwenhuis and Royal Rotterdam Lloyd
results.brief_description: Historical documentary of a round-the-world trip by the 23,000 ton Dutch liner, the “Willem Ruys”, beginning from Sydney and calling into Wellington (NZ), Lima (Peru), Balboa (Panama City), Miami, Bermuda, Southampton, Rotterdam, passing Portugal, Gibraltar and Malta to Port Said and into the Suez Canal. From the Suez Canal the voyage then continues on through the Red Sea to aden, into the Indian Ocean to Colombo, then Singapore, across the Equator past Java and Christmas Island to Cape Leeuwin and finally arriving in Melbourne.
